{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3134632,"name":"Josh Weeks","username":"MojoFilter","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mojofilter/{size}/182835_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-27T00:40:28.415Z","cooked":"

What might we have here? Both of our gear boxes from the base kit are getting this same intermediate click, which is more noticeable at slow speeds but happens with or without load.

Google Photos

New video by Josh Weeks

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2023-01-27T00:40:28.415Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":70,"reads":314,"readers_count":313,"score":412.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":424788,"topic_slug":"base-kit-gearbox-click","display_username":"Josh Weeks","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56675,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Destroyer of Worlds"},"post_url":"/t/base-kit-gearbox-click/424788/1","custom_user_title":"Destroyer of Worlds","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3134734,"name":"Tom Line","username":"Tom_Line","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tom_line/{size}/236809_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-27T04:13:19.321Z","cooked":"

Something is quite wrong.

First thing to check is that you’ve got the right size pinions and gears and everything is in the right holes.

Are you driving one motor or both motors in that test?

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2023-01-27T04:13:19.321Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":288,"readers_count":287,"score":97.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":424788,"topic_slug":"base-kit-gearbox-click","display_username":"Tom Line","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":7841,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Team 1498"},"post_url":"/t/base-kit-gearbox-click/424788/2","custom_user_title":"Team 1498","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3134822,"name":"Josh Weeks","username":"MojoFilter","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mojofilter/{size}/182835_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-27T13:10:53.968Z","cooked":"

That’s with both motors driving on that side. I don’t know that we ever tested it with just one going.

We did rebuild the gearbox, but the only fishy thing we found was a warped e-pin, which we were hoping was going to be the ticket, but apparently it’s something else.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2023-01-27T13:10:53.968Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":258,"readers_count":257,"score":71.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":424788,"topic_slug":"base-kit-gearbox-click","display_username":"Josh Weeks","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":7841,"username":"Tom_Line","name":"Tom Line","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tom_line/{size}/236809_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56675,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Destroyer of Worlds"},"post_url":"/t/base-kit-gearbox-click/424788/3","custom_user_title":"Destroyer of Worlds","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3134828,"name":"Andy Baker","username":"Andy_Baker","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/andy_baker/{size}/66341_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-27T13:34:55.722Z","cooked":"

This is weird. Usually, gearbox noises are cyclical an repeatable, like a beat in a song.

I can’t tell if one of your gear meshes is slipping, as Tom is hinting to above, or you have a bad bearing. I suggest disassembling again and trying to see if each bearing spins freely.

Let me know if you need any parts replaced.

Andy B.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2023-01-27T13:45:04.582Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":246,"readers_count":245,"score":124.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":424788,"topic_slug":"base-kit-gearbox-click","display_username":"Andy Baker","primary_group_name":"AndyMark","flair_name":"AndyMark","flair_url":"/uploads/default/original/3X/7/2/72db24f824a25ae17c6413b3d02a345e47f060a9.png","flair_bg_color":"","flair_color":"","flair_group_id":59,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=n7RuIga3vdk","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"RATE A RECORD - YouTube","clicks":16}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":17,"hidden":false,"trust_level":3,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/base-kit-gearbox-click/424788/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3134830,"name":"Josh Weeks","username":"MojoFilter","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mojofilter/{size}/182835_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-27T13:47:28.025Z","cooked":"

Appreciate it. Bearing checks will be the first thing on the agenda this evening.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2023-01-27T13:47:28.025Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":224,"readers_count":223,"score":64.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":424788,"topic_slug":"base-kit-gearbox-click","display_username":"Josh Weeks","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":17,"username":"Andy_Baker","name":"Andy Baker","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/andy_baker/{size}/66341_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56675,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Destroyer of Worlds"},"post_url":"/t/base-kit-gearbox-click/424788/5","custom_user_title":"Destroyer of Worlds","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3134907,"name":"","username":"Akash_Rastogi","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/akash_rastogi/{size}/169937_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-27T16:29:35.951Z","cooked":"

In addition to checking the bearings, was the gearbox actually greased?

Was anything overtightened? Gearboxes are best assembled with hand tools so nothing is over torqued.

Are gears assembled in the correct orientation paying attention to which faces of gears have little “nubs” vs what’s flat?

Were bearings pressed in gently using a soft material like wood? Or were they pressed on directly with a metal press or hammer?

Is the motor mounted correctly?

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2023-01-27T16:32:14.528Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":204,"readers_count":203,"score":45.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":424788,"topic_slug":"base-kit-gearbox-click","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":56675,"username":"MojoFilter","name":"Josh Weeks","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mojofilter/{size}/182835_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":8002,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"177 & 429 | #TeamWCP| #TeamThrifty"},"post_url":"/t/base-kit-gearbox-click/424788/6","custom_user_title":"177 & 429 | #TeamWCP| #TeamThrifty","reactions":[{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3134911,"name":"Josh Weeks","username":"MojoFilter","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mojofilter/{size}/182835_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-27T16:33:46.964Z","cooked":"

Lots of grease. I believe they were able to assemble everything by hand or with a rubber mallet. We’ll definitely be paying close attention to orientations when we take it apart again tonight.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2023-01-27T16:33:46.964Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":194,"readers_count":193,"score":43.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":424788,"topic_slug":"base-kit-gearbox-click","display_username":"Josh Weeks","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":8002,"username":"Akash_Rastogi","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/akash_rastogi/{size}/169937_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56675,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Destroyer of Worlds"},"post_url":"/t/base-kit-gearbox-click/424788/7","custom_user_title":"Destroyer of Worlds","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3134913,"name":"","username":"Akash_Rastogi","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/akash_rastogi/{size}/169937_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-27T16:35:07.851Z","cooked":"

@Andy_Baker I haven’t assembled one lately but do tough boxes still require the break in run?

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2023-01-27T16:35:07.851Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":194,"readers_count":193,"score":53.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":424788,"topic_slug":"base-kit-gearbox-click","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":56675,"username":"MojoFilter","name":"Josh Weeks","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mojofilter/{size}/182835_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":8002,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"177 & 429 | #TeamWCP| #TeamThrifty"},"post_url":"/t/base-kit-gearbox-click/424788/8","custom_user_title":"177 & 429 | #TeamWCP| #TeamThrifty","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3134920,"name":"Tom","username":"Zook","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/zook/{size}/252720_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-27T16:42:44.175Z","cooked":"

Try running just one motor at a time before disassembling. Remove the breaker for one, run it, swap, run it. See if only one side is presenting an issue, which could be poorly secured motor, or if there is a more general problem.

Our students put together one gearbox with a flipped gear, so the “ridge” was on the wrong side. So complete take apart was required.
In the past, we’ve had one CIM screwed in funky and it caused intermittent clicking sounds.

I asked an AndyMark engineer about it a while ago; they said it’s good practice but not required.

I agree that it’s not required, but it definitely won’t hurt.

Andy B.

Oooh, do tell us more about this break-in run…

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2023-01-27T18:25:32.138Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":155,"readers_count":154,"score":46.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":424788,"topic_slug":"base-kit-gearbox-click","display_username":"Josh Weeks","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":8002,"username":"Akash_Rastogi","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/akash_rastogi/{size}/169937_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56675,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Destroyer of Worlds"},"post_url":"/t/base-kit-gearbox-click/424788/12","custom_user_title":"Destroyer of Worlds","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3134991,"name":"Robert ","username":"Rlop","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/rlop/{size}/187463_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-27T18:38:35.314Z","cooked":"

To break in the gearbox you run the gearbox dry for half an hour, disassemble, clean out any metal shavings, and then reassemble with grease.

","post_number":13,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2023-01-27T18:38:35.314Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":12,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":140,"readers_count":139,"score":63.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":424788,"topic_slug":"base-kit-gearbox-click","display_username":"Robert ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":56675,"username":"MojoFilter","name":"Josh Weeks","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mojofilter/{size}/182835_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":47697,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/base-kit-gearbox-click/424788/13","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3134994,"name":"Ken Pontbriant","username":"electroken","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/electroken/{size}/160387_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-27T18:45:33.532Z","cooked":"

We’ve done the break-in run on many Toughbox variants and we’ve never heard any of those non-periodic sounds heard in the video before or after. The ridges on the gear sides have to face the bearings adjacent to the gears or the gears rub on things they shouldn’t rub.

I’m looking forward to the new Toughboxes with the symmetrical and pocketed gears!

","post_number":14,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2023-01-27T19:45:01.355Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":139,"readers_count":138,"score":27.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":424788,"topic_slug":"base-kit-gearbox-click","display_username":"Ken Pontbriant","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":17612,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC 230 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/base-kit-gearbox-click/424788/14","custom_user_title":"FRC 230 Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3135016,"name":"Nachiket Khambholja","username":"NachoMan_32","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/f05b48/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-01-27T19:49:51.425Z","cooked":"

I’m not sure if this applies to CIM motors, however, I sometimes hear a similar noise if I over tighten some screws on Falcon 500s. You might want to check if there is something similar on these motors. It could also be a bad bearing.

","post_number":15,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2023-01-27T19:49:51.425Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":126,"readers_count":125,"score":25.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":424788,"topic_slug":"base-kit-gearbox-click","display_username":"Nachiket Khambholja","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56812,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/base-kit-gearbox-click/424788/15","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3135146,"name":"Andy Baker","username":"Andy_Baker","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/andy_baker/{size}/66341_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-27T23:05:02.192Z","cooked":"

This shaft issue may be a root cause.

Wobbly Shaft Issue on '23 FRC Kit of Parts Toughbox General Forum
All, We have found that the steel output shaft (am-4722) used in the 2023 FRC Kit of Parts AM14U5 Chassis ToughBox is causing a problem. The 3/8" end of the shaft is slightly offset (~0.02") from the center of the shaft, and it appears to be very consistent. This eccentricity will cause a wobble on the middle wheel and Toughbox housing on the AM14U5. We found this out today, and have informed FIRST. Collectively, we will provide more information and solutions early next week. For technical hel…

Andy B.

Ok, that sounds exactly like our problem. Pulling everything else off, the shafts are definitely drawing circles.
